summary: This document is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Richard Kahn, the executor of Jeffrey Epstein's estate. It demands the production of documents related to 'The 1953 Trust' referenced in Epstein's will and requests Kahn's testimony before the grand jury on November 1, 2019. The document includes a non-disclosure request to preserve the confidentiality of the ongoing criminal investigation.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office was actively investigating potential federal crimes related to Jeffrey Epstein, including violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c), 2422(b) (coercion and enticement), and 371 (conspiracy), even after his death.
The subpoena specifically targets 'The 1953 Trust' referenced in Epstein's will, indicating the investigation was pursuing his financial assets and structures.
The government requested non-disclosure of the subpoena to preserve the confidentiality of the ongoing grand jury investigation.
Richard Kahn, as executor, was compelled to produce all documents related to the trust, including drafts, notes, and communications, in electronic format if possible.
The document demonstrates the use of a grand jury to gather evidence posthumously, focusing on Epstein's estate and trust arrangements.
